fees.name: Direct Debit Dishonour Fee

fees.additionalInfo: Payable when we issue you a deposit book.

fees.name: Transaction Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable each time any of the following transactions occur: a) you make a purchase or cash withdrawal using EFTPOS or your Visa Debit card (if card access is available for your account); or b) a cheque you wrote is presented for payment; or c) a deposit is made by you or another person into your account over the counter at one of our branches; or d) a cheque is deposited by you or another person into your account; or e) you or another person transfers funds into your account from another NPBS account, where this was arranged over the counter at one of our branches or where we are asked to arrange this.

listData.description: Low fixed rate with flexible repayment options.

features.additionalInfo: Flexible repayment options - Minimum monthly principal and interest repayments with weekly and fortnightly options available.
You can make regular additional repayments and extra lump sum payments.

constraints.additionalInfo: This maximum loan limit applies for unsecured loans.

eligibility.additionalValue: Must live in Australia and be either: an Australian citizen, an Australian permanent resident or a New Zealand citizen

fees.name: Substitution of Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Where you require that we vary the security we hold for your loan, a fee will apply.

fees.name: Application Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Assessing and processing your loan application can be an involved process, requiring the expertise of trained assessors. For this reason, an application fee is payable upon advance of your loan.

fees.name: Duplicate Statement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Document Retrieval fee, payable to us when we provide a copy of any statement, notice or other document at your request. Fee per copy document.

fees.name: Default Administration Fee 1
fees.additionalInfo: The default administration fee for Personal Loans is payable to us when a repayment due under your agreement is not made. The fee is $35 where one payment or less is in arrears, and $50 per month where more than one payment is in arrears.

fees.name: Default Administration Fee 2
fees.additionalInfo: Where more than one repayment is in default (the fee will be charged the month the payment is due and each later month until the month after you pay the amount).

fees.name: Dishonour Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A dishonour fee is payable when a payment direction you make, such as a direct debit, salary deduction or automatic transfer is dishonoured. The dishonour fee is per dishonour.

fees.name: Document Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Document Retrieval fee, payable to us when we provide a copy of any statement, notice or other document at your request. Fee per copy document.

fees.additionalInfo: This fee is charged for each loan account for which you've opted to lock in a rate, and for each instance of locking in a rate. We charge the Rate Lock Fee to your loan account on the day the loan is funded. Refer to ‘Facts for Mortgage Loans’ for more information.

fees.name: Consent Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we agree to a change relating to the title of the property.

fees.name: Settlement Cheque Fee NPBS Cheque only
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when we are required to issue Financial Institution Cheques for settlement. Financial Institution Cheque means a cheque which is issued by us and drawn on us. Where the settlement cheque is drawn by a third party, the fee charged to us by the third party will be passed on to you. The amount of these third party fees may vary and are unascertainable as at the date of these terms and conditions.

fees.name: Document and Miscellaneous Service
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies if you request copies of documents such as withdrawal slips or statements, you ask us to verify a transaction on your account or you request any other information. It is calculated on an hourly basis, and charged to your account on a pro-rata basis (subject to minimum charges applying) after the search is undertaken. $60/hour (min $10/copy).

fees.name: Dishonour (Direct Debit and Cheque)
fees.additionalInfo: If you ask us to take a payment, either direct debit or salary deduction and you do not have enough funds in your account to cover this payment, you will be charged a fee.

fees.name: Default Administration Fee 2
fees.additionalInfo: Where more than one repayment is in default (the fee will be charged the month the payment is due and each later month until the month after you pay the amount).

fees.name: Conversion Fee
fees.additionalInfo: May be payable when converting loan product type.

fees.name: Settlement Reschedule Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when your discharge settlement is cancelled and/or rescheduled. This fee is payable in either cash or cheque at the time of settlement.

fees.name: Title Search Fee
fees.additionalInfo: This comprises our external searcher’s fee and the Land and Property Information fees. (If the security involves a Community Scheme, or is outside New South Wales, or is old system title, this fee is unascertainable and may be higher. We may charge you what our solicitors or agents charge us to perform this search).

fees.name: Establishment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Establishing a loan is an involved process and requires the expertise of trained staff to assess the loan application, create detailed documentation, coordinate settlement and register the mortgage.

fees.name: International Transfer Inward
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies for the conversion of international transfers in a foreign currency to Australian dollars.

fees.name: Substitution in Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Security listed on a mortgage is changed. You may also be charged a valuation fee which is unascertainable.

fees.name: Break Costs Fixed Rate Loans
fees.additionalInfo: Are payable when before the end of the fixed rate period the borrower “breaks” the fixed rate by: repaying all of the amount owing; or repaying early more than $25,000 during any calendar year; or switching to another product, interest rate or payment type; or are in default and the total amount owing becomes immediately due for payment.

fees.name: Default Administration Fee 1
fees.additionalInfo: Where one payment or less is in arrears at the end of the month.

fees.name: Electronic Transfer Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when we are required to electronically transfer money for settlement.

fees.name: Redraw Fee via Branch
fees.additionalInfo: Redraw of advance funds via a Branch.

fees.name: Discharge Administration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we arrange for a discharge of mortgage. There may also be fees charged by a third party.

fees.name: Application Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when increasing borrowing against an existing security. Also known as a loan top-up.

fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we agree to a change relating to the title of the property or when we are required to produce a document to a title office, or consent to an action on PEXA (or any other property exchange system).

fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when your discharge settlement is cancelled and/or rescheduled. This fee is payable in either cash or cheque at the time of settlement.

fees.name: International Transfer Inward
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies for the conversion of international transfers in a foreign currency to Australian dollars.

fees.name: Document and Miscellaneous Service
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies if you request copies of documents such as withdrawal slips or statements, you ask us to verify a transaction on your account or you request any other information. It is calculated on an hourly basis, and charged to your account on a pro-rata basis (subject to minimum charges applying) after the search is undertaken. $60/hour (min $10/copy).

listData.description: If you need to borrow money for your business, whether it’s to purchase a property or any other business purpose, with our Business Fixed Rate Fully Drawn Advance you can enjoy the certainty of fixed interest rates and repayments.

features.additionalInfo: Eligible customers enjoy dedicated and personalised service from the Business Solutions team.

You can pay as much as you like however you need to be aware that if you repay more than a total of 10% of the facility amount in any 12 month period (commencing on 1 November and ending on 31 October the following year) a 0.25% fee is payable on the amount repaid in excess of this 10% limit.
Internet Banking and Mobile Banking
Flexible repayment terms available up to a maximum of 30 years if residentially secured, or to a maximum of 20 years if commercial, industrial, cash or mixed security.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Available for business purposes for individual and non-individual borrowers, including sole traders, trusts (excluding SMSFs) and companies.

eligibility.additionalValue: Available to permanent Australian Residents.

fees.name: Interest Rate Conversion Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Fee is payable for interest rate maintenance/conversion with a Letter of Variation or Letter of Advice.

fees.name: Valuation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: The cost of each valuation report required to be issued.

fees.name: Limit Excess Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A limit excess fee of $17.50 each time the facility limit is exceeded. If the balance owing exceeds the facility limit with or without our approval, we charge interest on that excess at the default rate.

fees.name: Upfront Fees Residential Security
fees.additionalInfo: For new facilities secured by residential property, this single fee replaces Application Fee, Valuation Fee, Legal and Documentation Fee.

fees.name: Break Cost Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Are payable when a break cost event occurs: (a) we allow you to switch from a fixed interest rate for a facility to a variable interest rate during a fixed interest period or (b) you repay early all or any part of the total amount owing for that facility before the end of a fixed interest period or (c) the total amount owing for that facility becomes repayable because you are in default.

fees.name: Partial Release and Discharge of Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we arrange for a Partial Release or Discharge of Security.

fees.name: Replacement Document Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Fee is payable for replacement of documents due to the original documentation being lost or amendments to the original documents being required.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Settlement fee is estimated at $300 per settlement.

fees.name: Upfront Legal & Document Fees
fees.additionalInfo: Minimum Fee is $250. The costs for reviewing documents and preparing security documents and facility agreements differ based on the type of security and other factors. The estimated fees will be provided in your Letter of Offer.

fees.name: Registration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when there are additional costs associated with registration (for example, this may include a discharge of mortgage fee, transfer fee or any other dealing fee).

fees.name: Application Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Also known as establishment fee and payable when you accept the commercial letter of offer. (Does not apply to Residentially Secured Business Loan).

fees.name: Rate Lock Fee
fees.additionalInfo: This fee is charged for each loan account for which you've opted to lock in a rate, and for each instance of locking in a rate. We charge the Rate Lock Fee to your loan account on the day the loan is funded. Refer to ‘Facts for Mortgage Loans’ for more information.

fees.name: Discharge Administration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we arrange for a discharge of mortgage. There may also be fees charged by a third party.

fees.name: Break Costs Fixed Rate Loans
fees.additionalInfo: Are payable when before the end of the fixed rate period the borrower “breaks” the fixed rate by: repaying all of the amount owing; or repaying early more than $25,000 during any calendar year; or switching to another product, interest rate or payment type; or are in default and the total amount owing becomes immediately due for payment.

fees.name: Electronic Transfer Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when we are required to electronically transfer money for settlement.

fees.name: Application Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when increasing borrowing against an existing security. Also known as a loan top-up.

fees.name: Settlement Cheque Fee NPBS Cheque only
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when we are required to issue Financial Institution Cheques for settlement. Financial Institution Cheque means a cheque which is issued by us and drawn on us. Where the settlement cheque is drawn by a third party, the fee charged to us by the third party will be passed on to you. The amount of these third party fees may vary and are unascertainable as at the date of these terms and conditions.

fees.name: Substitution in Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Security listed on a mortgage is changed. You may also be charged a valuation fee which is unascertainable.

fees.name: Default Administration Fee 1
fees.additionalInfo: Where one payment or less is in arrears at the end of the month.

fees.name: Settlement Reschedule Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when your discharge settlement is cancelled and/or rescheduled. This fee is payable in either cash or cheque at the time of settlement.

fees.name: Redraw Fee via Branch
fees.additionalInfo: Redraw of advance funds via a Branch.

fees.name: Consent Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we agree to a change relating to the title of the property or when we are required to produce a document to a title office, or consent to an action on PEXA (or any other property exchange system).

fees.name: Default Administration Fee 2
fees.additionalInfo: Where more than one repayment is in default (the fee will be charged the month the payment is due and each later month until the month after you pay the amount).

fees.name: Document and Miscellaneous Service
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies if you request copies of documents such as withdrawal slips or statements, you ask us to verify a transaction on your account or you request any other information. It is calculated on an hourly basis, and charged to your account on a pro-rata basis (subject to minimum charges applying) after the search is undertaken. $60/hour (min $10/copy).

fees.name: Establishment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Establishing a loan is an involved process and requires the expertise of trained staff to assess the loan application, create detailed documentation, coordinate settlement and register the mortgage.

fees.name: International Transfer Inward
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies for the conversion of international transfers in a foreign currency to Australian dollars.

fees.name: Conversion Fee
fees.additionalInfo: May be payable when converting loan product type.

fees.name: Title Search Fee
fees.additionalInfo: This comprises our external searcher’s fee and the Land and Property Information fees. fees.name: Dishonour (Direct Debit and Cheque)
fees.additionalInfo: If you ask us to take a payment, either direct debit or salary deduction and you do not have enough funds in your account to cover this payment, you will be charged a fee.

fees.name: Break Cost Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Are payable when a break cost event occurs: (a) we allow you to switch from a fixed interest rate for a facility to a variable interest rate during a fixed interest period or (b) you repay early all or any part of the total amount owing for that facility before the end of a fixed interest period or (c) the total amount owing for that facility becomes repayable because you are in default.

fees.name: Financial Institution Cheque
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies at the time you draw a financial institution cheque. It accrues during the month, is debited to your account on the last day of the month and is charged to your account after close of business on the last day of the month.

fees.name: Visa Cash Advance
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies for cash withdrawals performed by using a Visa debit card at some foreign ATMs (when pressing the credit button) or for cash withdrawals at overseas ATMs. It also applies for cash advances made over the counter at other financial institutions. It is debited to your account at the time of each transaction. In addition, you may be charged a fee by the other financial institution at the time of the cash withdrawal. Any fee charged should be advised by the other financial institution at the time of the cash withdrawal. It will be charged to your account at the time of the transaction and be included in the total cash advance amount printed on your statement.

fees.name: Settlement Reschedule Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when your discharge settlement is cancelled and/or rescheduled. This fee is payable in either cash or cheque at the time of settlement.

fees.name: Document and Miscellaneous Service
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies if you request copies of documents such as withdrawal slips or statements, you ask us to verify a transaction on your account or you request any other information. It is calculated on an hourly basis, and charged to your account on a pro-rata basis (subject to minimum charges applying) after the search is undertaken. $60/hour (min $10/copy).

fees.name: Electronic Transfer Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable to us when we are required to electronically transfer money for settlement.

fees.name: Unclaimed Moneys Administration
fees.additionalInfo: P6M. Fee applies if your account becomes unclaimed due to the application of the Banking Act 1959 and reflects our costs in checking for any known contacts and the search of related accounts. It is debited to your account on closure of account.

fees.name: Discharge Administration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable whenever we arrange for a discharge of mortgage. There may also be fees charged by a third party.

fees.name: Visa Cash Advance
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies for cash withdrawals performed by using a Visa debit card at some foreign ATMs (when pressing the credit button) or for cash withdrawals at overseas ATMs. It also applies for cash advances made over the counter at other financial institutions. It is debited to your account at the time of each transaction. In addition, you may be charged a fee by the other financial institution at the time of the cash withdrawal. Any fee charged should be advised by the other financial institution at the time of the cash withdrawal. It will be charged to your account at the time of the transaction and be included in the total cash advance amount printed on your statement.

fees.name: Substitution in Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Security listed on a mortgage is changed.

fees.name: Other Fees and Charges

fees.name: Dishonour (Direct Debit and Cheque)
fees.additionalInfo: If you ask us to take a payment, either direct debit or salary deduction and you do not have enough funds in your account to cover this payment, you will be charged a fee.

fees.name: Foreign Currency Conversion
fees.additionalInfo: Fee applies when you use your Visa debit card to perform a transaction overseas or where a merchant processes the payment overseas. It is calculated as a percentage of the total transaction amount and is included in the total amount debited to your account.

fees.name: Default Administration Fee 1
